column4: Anyone know why I can't view PHP files from localhost webserver? Web browser tries to download the file instead.
have you installed the apache php library?
Yeah, I believe so. What's the package called?
Yeah, I have it installed but I use libapache2-mod-php5
maybe script isnt exectutable or something simple like that?
No, they don't need to be executable, only readable. The PHP engine parses the files when they are read.
I had it working earlier, but then started f@**ing w/ it to get something else that wasn't working working. Suddenly I can't view the pages anymore. (Did a bunch of reinstalls).
it always worked fine for me in the past also... I never had to do anything special
It worked fine for me also on the first install, but despite having php-db installed, I couldn't use the MSSQL connection type in the PEAR DB class.
So I tried installing/reinstalling packages and then suddenly it's broke.
did you try restarting the webserver?
what does "cat /etc/mime.types | grep php" tell you?
It's got the correct mime types in there
shouldnt you have something for php{3,4,5} in mime.types?
There is nothing for 5, but there are types for 3 and 4.
